snippet: To the chagrin of the artist, the city of Venice plans to remove the 2009 sculpture “Boy With a Frog” from a pivotal spot next to the Punta della Dogana museum.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; Venice plans to remove 2009 sculpture Boy With Frog, by artist Charles Ray, from its spot next to Punta della Dogana museum; Christie's old master painting sale is to include The Duet by Gerrit van Honthorst, expected to fetch $2 million to $3 million; Museum of Modern Art decides to combine its prints and illustrated books and drawings departments after departure of curator Connie Butler; Larry Gagosian announces 20-year lease on 22,000-square-foot space in London's Mayfair district.
lead_paragraph: To the chagrin of the artist, the city of Venice plans to remove the 2009 sculpture “Boy With a Frog” from a pivotal spot next to the Punta della Dogana museum.

headline.seo: ‘Boy With Frog’ to Be Removed in Venice
headline.main: ‘Boy With Frog’ to Be Removed in Venice
